channel.title: AMS Council Agenda Feed
channel.description: A feed that parses the agendas for AMS Council

item.title: AMS Council Agenda – September 10, 2025 at 6:00 PM
item.guid: AMS Council Agenda – September 10, 2025 at 6:00 PM
item.content:encoded:
AMS Council Meeting

Alma Mater Society of UBC Vancouver

Wednesday, September 10, 2025 at 6:00 PM PDT to Wednesday, September 10, 2025 at 10:00 PM PDT

Michael Kingsmill Forum + Zoom for Councillors (must be pre-arranged with the President): https://ubc.zoom.us/j/68210956540?pwd=HHfR2o0zlbVx5sfbVqSwAOAla1imXE.1

Meeting Details: https://ubc.zoom.us/j/68210956540?pwd=HHfR2o0zlbVx5sfbVqSwAOAla1imXE.1

Meeting ID: 682 1095 6540

Passcode: 772617

Additional Meeting Details: Riley Huntley | AMS President is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: AMS Council [In-person]

Time: Sep 10, 2025 18:00 Pacific Time (US and Canada)

Every 2 weeks on Wed, until Dec 3, 2025, 7 occurrence(s)

Sep 10, 2025 18:00

Sep 24, 2025 18:00

Oct 8, 2025 18:00

Oct 22, 2025 18:00

Nov 5, 2025 18:00

Nov 19, 2025 18:00

Dec 3, 2025 18:00

Please download and import the following iCalendar (.ics) files to your calendar system.

Weekly: https://ubc.zoom.us/meeting/u5wvdumhqz0vHtSgVBAjQpYfaVCIoYBpcKcz/ics?icsToken=98tyKu-grDoqE9GTtR2HR_M-

AIj4c_PwmCFYgrdumynHIipicjrwN9RhG71GMsjT&meetingMasterEventId=ZZJH0uqYQt-lMwCXRpylnA

Join Zoom Meeting: https://ubc.zoom.us/j/68210956540?pwd=HHfR2o0zlbVx5sfbVqSwAOAla1imXE.1

Meeting ID: 682 1095 6540

Passcode: 772617

One tap mobile:

+17789072071,,68210956540#,,,,,,0#,,772617#

Dial by your location:

+1 204 272 7920 (Vancouver)

+1 587 328 1099 (Montreal)

+1 613 209 3054 (Alberta)

+1 647 374 4685 (Ottawa)

+1 778 907 2071 (Toronto)

+1 438 809 7799 (Manitoba)

Meeting ID: 682 1095 6540

Passcode: 772617

Join from a videoconferencing system:

IP: 159.124.196.25 (Canada Vancouver) or 159.124.168.213 (Canada Toronto)

Meeting ID: 682 1095 6540

Passcode: 772617

SIP: 68210956540@vn.zmca.us

Passcode: 772617

Agenda

I. Call to Order 6:00 PM

Councillors: Please complete the ongoing COI disclosure survey (linked and visible under Actions in OnBoard) prior to participating in the meeting.

Meeting will be called to order by 6:10 PM at the latest.

II. Territorial Acknowledgement 6:10 PM

III. Approval of the Agenda

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT the agenda be adopted as presented."

A. Agenda Amendment

Agenda additions:

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT the agenda be amended as presented"

IV. Membership and Attendance: Introductions, New Members, Declaration of Vacancies

A. New Members

Presenter: Alex Stolz

Medicine: Alex Stolz (Returning Councilor - Nursing, 2024/2025)

B. Vacancies

GSS, Affiliates

C. Goodbyes

V. Speaker's Business and Remarks

Presenter: Riley Huntley

VI. Statements from Students-at-Large 6:12 PM

Statement from student-at-large - 3 minutes

Response from Councillors - 3 minutes

Closing remarks from student-at-large - 1 minute

Note: Up to three students at large may address Council.

VII. Approval of Minutes of Council and Committees 6:33 PM

Proposed motion:

BE IT RESOLVED THAT the following minutes be accepted as presented:

• Executive Committee minutes dated August 12, 2025

• Executive Committee minutes dated August 19, 2025

• Executive Committee minutes dated August 26, 2025

• Building Operations Committee minutes dated August 12, 2025

• Clubs and Societies Meeting minutes dated August 7, 2025

• External Briefs and Communications Committee minutes dated July 14, 2025

• HR Committee Minutes dated August 12, 2025 (revised)

• HR Committee Minutes dated July 16, 2025

• HR Committee Minutes dated June 20, 2025

• HR Committee Minutes dated June 4, 2025

• Minutes of AMS Council dated April 26, 2025

In camera minutes:

• In camera Council minutes, April 26, 2025

• In camera HR Committee minutes dated August 12, 2025

• In camera HR Committee minutes dated June 4, 2025

To view in camera minutes, contact Sheldon (archives@ams.ubc.ca)

VIII. Consent Items

A. Consent Items Requiring a Simple Majority

1. Committee Goals 6:36 PM

From the Human Resources Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council approve the HR Committee goals as presented."

B. Consent Items Requiring a Two-Thirds Majority

1. Code & Policy Suspension re AMS By-Election 6:39 PM

From the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council suspend AMS Internal Policy GV5: Elections Rules and Regulations Section 19(a) regarding presentation of the Candidates' Handbook to AMS

Council.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council suspend the Code of Procedures Section V,

Article 14, items 2-3 and Section V, Article 2, item (e), and Section IX, Article 2, item 8, para. (v) until the next regularly scheduled meeting of Council.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council delegate authority to the Elections Committee to appoint the two Polling Officers.

Note: Requires 2/3rds

IX. Presentations and Accompanying Motions

X. Executive and Committee Motions

A. Winter Committee Appointments 6:42 PM

Proposed motions (placeholder):

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT (5 non-Executive Council members) be appointed to the External Briefs and Communications Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026. • Note: The committee is chaired by the VP External Affairs and shall meet at least once a month. The President also sits on this committee. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (5 non-Executive Council members) be appointed to the

Human Resources Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first

Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by a non-Executive voting member of Council and shall meet at least once a month. The President, Senior Manager Human Resources, and the Ombudsperson (non-voting) also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (4 non-Executive Council members) be appointed to the

Finance Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by the VP Finance and shall meet at least once every two weeks. The President, AVP Finance (non-voting) and the Managing Director

(non-voting) also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (4 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed to the Building

Operations Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by the VP Administration and shall meet at least once every two weeks. The President, Design Office Manager (non-voting) and the

Building Operations Manager (non-voting) also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (3 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed to the Clubs and

Societies Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by the VP Administration and shall meet at least once every two weeks (during the school year). The President, student staff of the

VP Administration, and VP Finance also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (4 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed to the Events

Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in

May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by a non-Executive voting member of Council and shall meet at least once a month. The VP Finance, VP Student Life, President and the

Senior Manager Events & Student Development (non-voting) also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (5 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed to the

Governance Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by a non-Executive voting member of Council and shall meet at least every two weeks. The Clerk of Council and President also sit on this committee.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (4 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed as regular members and (2 non-Executive Councilors) be appointed as alternates to the Election

Appeals Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

• Note: The committee is chaired by the Speaker and shall meet upon receipt of an appeal. The AMS Ombudsperson (non-voting) also sits on this committee."

B. Committee Chair Appointments 7:27 PM

Proposed motion (placeholder):

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT (non-Executive voting member of Council) be appointed Chair of the Human Resources Committee effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (non-Executive voting member of Council) be appointed

Chair of the Governance Committee effective immediately and ending at the first Council meeting in May 2026.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT (non-Executive voting member of Council) be appointed

Chair of the Events Committee for a period effective immediately and ending at the first

Council meeting in May 2026."

Note: Chairs shall work on average three (3) hours per week and non-Executive Chairs receive remuneration to that effect.

C. EPA Committee Appointments 7:47 PM

Proposed motion (placeholder):

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT (4 non-Executive voting Council members) be appointed to the Executive Performance and Accountability Committee for a period effectively immediately and ending at a Council meeting in May 2026. • Note: The committee is chaired by the Speaker and shall meet at least once a month.

D. Student Staff Commons Renovation 7:52 PM

From the President and Vice-President Administration

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council suspend Code of Procedure Section IX, Article 6(5)(a)(vii) BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council approve up to $30,000 be approved from the Capital Projects Fund to cover the cost of the proposed renovation to the AMS Student Staff Commons space."

Note: Requires 2/3rd

E. Annual General Meeting 7:59 PM

From the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT the date for the AMS Annual General Meeting be set for October 22, 2025."

XI. Constituency and Affiliate Motions

XII. Discussions and Consultation

XIII. President's Business and Remarks 8:02 PM

Presenter: Riley Huntley

Updates - 5 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XIV. Executive Business and Remarks

A. VP Academic & University Affairs 8:08 PM

Presenter: Zarifa Nawar

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

B. VP Administration 8:12 PM

Presenter: Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

C. VP External Affairs 8:16 PM

Presenter: Solomon Yi-Kieran

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

D. VP Finance 8:20 PM

Presenter: Gagan Parmar

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

E. VP Student Life 8:24 PM

Presenter: Kevin Heieis

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

F. Managing Director 8:28 PM

Presenter: Justin Lieu

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

G. Senior Manager of Student Services 8:32 PM

Presenter: Kathleen Simpson

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XV. Committee Reports

A. Building Operations Committee 8:36 PM

Presenter: Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

B. Clubs and Societies Committee 8:39 PM

Presenter: Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

C. Events Committee 8:42 PM

Presenter: Humleen Samra

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

D. External Briefs and Communications Committee 8:45 PM

Presenter: Solomon Yi-Kieran

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

E. Finance Committee 8:48 PM

Presenter: Gagan Parmar

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

F. Governance Committee 8:51 PM

Presenter: Sarah Wong

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

G. Human Resources Committee 8:54 PM

Presenter: Mya Tsai

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

H. Executive Performance and Accountability Committee (EPA) 8:57 PM

Presenter: Jasper Lorien

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XVI. Report from Presidents' Council 9:00 PM

Presenter: Riley Huntley

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XVII. Board of Governors, Senate, & Ombudsperson Reports

A. Board of Governors 9:03 PM

Presenters: Cade Desjarlais, Jasper Lorien

B. Senate 9:06 PM

Presenters: Zarifa Nawar, Kareem Hassib

C. Ombudsperson 9:09 PM

Presenter: Noah Mossey

XVIII. Historical Update 9:12 PM

Presenter: Sheldon Goldfarb

XIX. Other Business, Including In Camera Discussions, Notices of Motions and Submissions

A. In Camera Session

1. Appointment Discussions 9:22 PM

2. Speaker Appointment 9:37 PM

From the Human Resources Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council appoint _____ as Speaker of Council BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council suspend Section V, Article 13(1)(a) of the AMS

Code of Procedure so that the Speaker of Council shall not be the Chair of the EPA

Committee until after the September 24 meeting of Council."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

3. AMS Elections - Appointment 9:40 PM

From the President

Proposed motion:

BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council appoint ___ as Chief Returning Officer and ______ as

Events & Communications Officer on the recommendation of the Elections

Administrator and AMS Human Resources.

XX. Next Meeting and Adjournment

Next Council meeting time and date: 6:00 pm on September 24, 2025.

Supporting Documents

  • Zoom Link: https://ubc.zoom.us/j/68210956540?pwd=HHfR2o0zlbVx5sfbVqSwAOAla1imXE.1
  • Building Operations Committee Minutes – Aug 12, 2025
  • Clubs and Societies Committee Minutes – Aug 7, 2025
  • Executive Committee Minutes – Aug 12, 2025
  • Executive Committee Minutes – Aug 19, 2025
  • Executive Committee Minutes – Aug 26, 2025
  • External Briefs Committee Minutes – July 14, 2025
  • HR Committee Minutes – July 16, 2025
  • HR Committee Minutes – June 20, 2025
  • HR Committee Goals
  • AMS Office Space – Proposed Project Budget
  • AMS Office Space – Proposed Project Rendering
  • President’s Updates to Council
  • VP AUA’s Updates to Council
  • VP Admin’s Updates to Council
  • VP External’s Updates to Council
  • VP Finance’s Updates to Council
  • VP Student Life’s Updates to Council
  • Senior Manager of Student Services’ Updates to Council
  • Managing Director’s Updates to Council

item.title: AMS Council Agenda – August 20, 2025 at 6:00 PM
item.guid: AMS Council Agenda – August 20, 2025 at 6:00 PM
item.content:encoded:
AMS Council Meeting

Alma Mater Society of UBC Vancouver

Wednesday, August 20, 2025 at 6:00 PM PDT to Wednesday, August 20, 2025 at

10:00 PM PDT

Michael Kingsmill Forum + Zoom for Councillors (must be pre-arranged with the President): https://ubc.zoom.us/j/61361551422?pwd=WDhIblhkNEVEcFIyT1lsMjhBc0tSQT09

Meeting Details: https://ubc.zoom.us/j/67159029217?pwd=gC09KpyYLXdpwG3aCLvwMoh30huCs7.1

Meeting ID: 613 6155 1422

Passcode: 968875

Additional Meeting Details: Join Zoom Meeting: https://ubc.zoom.us/j/67159029217?pwd=gC09KpyYLXdpwG3aCLvwMoh30huCs7.1

Meeting ID: 671 5902 9217

Passcode: 947251

One tap mobile:

+17789072071,,67159029217#,,,,,,0#,,947251#

Dial by your location:

+1 613 209 3054 (Vancouver)

+1 778 907 2071 (Montreal)

+1 204 272 7920 (Alberta)

+1 438 809 7799 (Ottawa)

+1 587 328 1099 (Toronto)

+1 647 374 4685 (Manitoba)

Meeting ID: 671 5902 9217

Passcode: 947251

Join from a videoconferencing system:

IP: 159.124.196.25 (Canada Vancouver) or 159.124.168.213 (Canada Toronto)

Meeting ID: 671 5902 9217

Passcode: 947251

SIP: 67159029217@vn.zmca.us

Passcode: 947251

Agenda

I. Call to Order 6:00 PM

Councillors: Please complete the ongoing COI disclosure survey (linked and visible under Actions in OnBoard) prior to participating in the meeting.

Meeting will begin by 6:10 PM at the latest.

II. Territorial Acknowledgement 6:10 PM

Presenter: Jasper Lorien

III. Approval of the Agenda 6:12 PM

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT the agenda be adopted as presented."

IV. Membership and Attendance: Introductions, New Members, Declaration of Vacancies6:13 PM

A. New Members

B. Vacancies

GSS, Medicine, Affiliates

C. Goodbyes

V. Speaker's Business and Remarks 6:14 PM

Presenter: Jasper Lorien

VI. Statements from Students-at-Large 6:16 PM

Statement from student-at-large - 3 minutes

Response from Councillors - 3 minutes

Closing remarks from student-at-large - 1 minute

Note: Up to three students at large may address Council.

VII. Approval of Minutes of Council and Committees 6:37 PM

Proposed motion:

BE IT RESOLVED THAT the following minutes be accepted as presented:

AMS Council & Committee minutes

Minutes of the EPA Committee dated July 22, 2025

Minutes of the Executive Committee dated July 8, 2025

Minutes of the Executive Committee dated July 15, 2025

Minutes of the Executive Committee dated July 22, 2025

Minutes of the Executive Committee dated July 29, 2025

Minutes of the Executive Committee dated August 5, 2025

Minutes of Council dated April 9, 2025

Minutes of the HR Committee minutes dated August 12, 2025

AMS GSS Health & Dental Plan minutes dated June 23, 2025

Minutes of the Finance Committee dated August 1, 2025

Minutes of the Events Committee minutes dated June 4, 2025

Minutes of the Governance Committee dated June 5, 2025

Minutes of the Governance Committee dated June 26, 2025

Minutes of the Governance Committee dated July 7,2025

Minutes of the Governance Committee dated July 21, 2025

AMS In Camera minutes

To view the in camera minutes contact Sheldon (archives@ams.ubc.ca)

In camera Council minutes:

April 9, 2025

June 11, 2025

July 23, 2025

In camera EPA Committee minutes:

July 22, 2025

VIII. Consent Items

A. Consent Items Requiring a Simple Majority

1. Governance Committee Goals

Presenter: Sarah Wong

From the Governance Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT the report Governance Committee goals be approved as presented."

B. Consent Items Requiring a Two-Thirds Majority

1. Code Change re Senate and BoG reps

Presenters: Sarah Wong, Riley Huntley

Proposed motion:

From the Governance Committee

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Governance Committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: Senate and BoG Reps as Directors' and thus amend the Code as recommended."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

2. Code Change re Grad Class Gift

Presenters: Sarah Wong, Riley Huntley

Proposed motion:

From the Governance Committee

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Governance Committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: Grad Class Gift' and thus amend the Code as recommended."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

3. Code Suspension re Resource Groups & Disability Support Funding

Presenter: Riley Huntley

From the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Section XI, Article 3(6)(b) of Code be suspended; BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT the MOU with the UBC Disabilities United Collective be approved; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT $10,000 from the Resource Centre Entrance Renovation Project surplus be allocated to the Sensory Room Refurbishment Project. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT $5,000 from the Resource Group Fund be allocated for the purposes of undertaking deep cleaning of the Resource Group Lounge and procuring cleaning supplies dedicated to the lounge."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

4. Code Change re International Projects Fund

Presenters: Sarah Wong, Gagan Parmar

Proposed motion:

From the Governance Committee

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Governance Committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: International Projects Fund' and thus amend the Code as recommended."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

5. Code Change and Revised Policy re Committee Appointments

Presenters: Sarah Wong, Riley Huntley

From the Governance Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Governance committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: Committee Appointments' and thus amend the Code as recommended. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council approve the revised policy GV2 entitled 'Committee Appointments'. Note: Requires 2/3rds 6. Code Suspension re VP Student Life By-Election Presenter: Riley Huntley From the President Proposed motion: "BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council suspend paragraph 110 of Policy GV5 entitled 'Elections Rules and Regulations' to allow the by-election for the VP Student Life to take place without polling booths."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

7. Undergraduate Fee - KUS

From the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council suspend Code Section XII, Article 6(3) to allow the KUS fee to be presented to Council. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council, pursuant to the University Act and Bylaw 14(6) of the Society, give notice to the Board of Governors to introduce the special fee levy for students in the Kinesiology Undergraduate Society (KUS) of $50 to go towards the KUS

Student Space in the new Gateway North building starting in Winter Session 2025/26, and that the Vice-President Finance send this notice to the Board of Governors."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

8. Revised Policy re: FN3 Executive Expenditures

Presenter: Gagan Parmar

From the Finance Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the revised policy FN3 entitled 'Executive Expenditures'. Note: Requires 2/3rds 9. Revised Policy re: FN2 Credit Cards Presenter: Gagan Parmar From the Finance Committee Proposed motion: "BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the revised policy FN2 entitled 'Credit Cards'. Note: Requires 2/3rds 10. Revised Policy re Video Surveillance Presenters: Riley Huntley, Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

From the Building Operations Committee and the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the revised policy SR4 entitled 'Video Surveillance'. Note: Requires 2/3rds. This document will be updated, before the public Council agenda, with minor revisions from AMS legal counsel. 11. Code Change re EPA Survey From the Executive Performance and Accountability Committee "BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Executive Performance and Accountability Committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: EPA Survey."

IX. Presentations and Accompanying Motions

A. AMS Final Budget 2025-2026 6:39 PM

Presenter: Gagan Parmar

From the Finance Committee and Vice-President Finance

Proposed motion:

Presentation: 15 minutes

Questions: 3 minutes

B. Consultation: Executive Commons Renovation 6:57 PM

Presenters: Riley Huntley, Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

Guest: Michael Kingsmill

From the President and Vice President Administration

Presentation: 7 minutes

Questions: 3 minutes

Presentation will be presented at the meeting

X. Executive and Committee Motions

A. Code Changes and Revised Policy re Recognized Organizations 7:04 PM

Presenters: Riley Huntley, Dylan Evans (he/him/his), Sarah Wong

From the President, Governance Committee and the Clubs and Societies Committee

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the report from the Governance Committee entitled 'Code Changes 2025: Subsidiary Organizations' and thus amend the Code as recommended. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the recommendation from the Clubs and Societies Committee to approve the new policy GV7 entitled 'Recognized Organizations'."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

B. Revised Policy re Removals, Suspensions and Expulsions from AMS Premises 7:07 PM

Presenters: Riley Huntley, Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

From the Building Operations Committee and the President

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council adopt the revised policy BU1 entitled 'Removals, Suspensions and Expulsions from AMS Premises'. Note: Requires 2/3rds. This document will be updated, before the public Council agenda, with minor revisions from AMS legal counsel.

C. AMS Fitness Access Bursary 7:10 PM

Presenters: Riley Huntley, Kevin Heieis

From the President and VP Student Life:

Proposed motion:

"BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council approve an allocation of $75,000 from the AMS Financial Assistance Fund to establish a one-time Fitness Access Bursary for the 2025/2026 Academic Year to support students in financial need for whom the cost of a recreation membership is a barrier to access; BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT this bursary be launched in Fall 2025 in commemoration of the opening of the UBC-AMS Recreation Centre North facility and administered in coordination with UBC Athletics & Recreation; BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED THAT disbursement criteria and student outreach be developed by the AMS Vice-President Student Life and administered by the Office of the AMS Vice- President Finance, with associated costs to be covered from within the approved allocation."

Note: Requires 2/3rds

XI. Discussions and Consultation

XII. President's Business and Remarks 7:13 PM

Presenter: Riley Huntley

Updates - 5 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XIII. Executive Business and Remarks

A. VP Academic & University Affairs 7:18 PM

Presenter: Zarifa Nawar

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

B. VP Administration 7:21 PM

Presenter: Dylan Evans (he/him/his)

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

C. VP External Affairs 7:24 PM

Presenter: Solomon Yi-Kieran

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

D. VP Finance 7:27 PM

Presenter: Gagan Parmar

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XIV. Committee Reports (3 minutes each)

B. Clubs and Societies Committee 7:42 PM

Question period - maximum 3 questions

H. Executive Performance and Accountability Committee (EPA) 8:00 PM

Presenter: Jasper Lorien

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XV. Report from Presidents' Council 8:03 PM

Presenter: Riley Huntley

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XVI. Board of Governors, Senate, & Ombudsperson Reports

A. Board of Governors 8:04 PM

Presenters: Cade Desjarlais, Jasper Lorien

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

B. Senate 8:05 PM

Presenters: Zarifa Nawar, Kareem Hassib

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

C. Ombudsperson 8:08 PM

Presenter: Noah Mossey

Updates - 3 minutes

Question period - maximum 3 questions

XVII. Historical Update 8:09 PM

Presenter: Sheldon Goldfarb

XVIII. Other Business, Including In Camera Discussions, Notices of Motions and Submissions

A. In Camera Session

1. EBC Briefs 8:19 PM

From the External Briefs and Communications Committee and the Vice-President

External

Presentation time: 15 minutes

Question time: 5 minutes

Proposed motion:

BE IT RESOLVED THAT Council approve briefs from the External Briefs and

Communications Committee entitled 'BC3 BC Ferries Letter' and 'BC3 YCC Letter'.

2. Executive Performance and Accountability - Monthly Session 8:39 PM

XIX. Next Meeting and Adjournment
